facts.text: Petitioner is a limited company with its registered office at Madurai in the State of Madras which owns a fleet of buses and lorries and carries on the business of transport.
In respect of assessment year 1960-61, petitioner claimed a development rebate on all its plants and machinery including transport vehicles.
Income Tax Officer disallowed the claim of rebate on transport vehicles under the second proviso to s.10(2)(vi-b) and computed the tax payable without such rebate.
Petition under Art. 32 of the Constitution challenging constitutionality of second proviso to s.10(2)(vi-b) of Income Tax Act introduced by Taxation Laws Amendment Act 28 of 1960.

legal_issues.text: Whether the second proviso to s.10(2)(vi-b) of Income Tax Act offends Art. 14 in that it discriminates between machinery which is office appliance or road transport vehicles and other kind of machinery.

petitioner_arguments.text: The proviso offends Art. 14 in that it discriminates between machinery which is office appliance or road transport vehicles and other kind of machinery.

court_reasoning.text: It is difficult to accept such a contention because there is nothing in the Constitution which prevents the legislature from choosing the object of taxation from amongst various classes of machinery for the purpose of giving development rebate.
court_reasoning.key_observation: The Constitution does not prohibit any such classification which has been made in the present case.

holdings.text: The second proviso to s.10(2)(vi-b) does not offend Art. 14 as the legislature is not prevented by the Constitution from classifying machinery for development rebate purposes.

statutes_cited.name: Income Tax Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Second proviso disallows development rebate on office appliances or road transport vehicles; challenged as unconstitutional

statutes_cited.name: Taxation Laws (Amendment) Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Introduced the second proviso to s.10(2)(vi-b)

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Art. 32 for petition; Art. 14 alleged violation by discriminatory proviso

outcome.summary: The petition is wholly without merit and is therefore dismissed and the rule is discharged.
